page.title: 20CRAMOND :Craigiehall Camp
page.content: Old Craigiehall House is now the Officers' Mess for the Scottish offices and the high security modern administration offices are in the House's old walled garden. The residential,catering and recreational accomodation is divided up by large playing fields and woodland. The river, old architecture and farmland make it seem very unmilitary despite the smart uniforms and the saluting. There are more civilians than army personnel in the camp but there is a landscaped magazine for ammunition and fierce guard dogs patrol the perimeter fence. We met the Charge Hand who is responsible for the five Alsation guard dogs and one sniffer dog. He took us inside the dogs' compound. We preferred the friendly spaniel Sam who had accompanied his master, our host.
